summary: The federal government spends over $90 billion a year on information technology. Earlier, we found that agencies sometimes award contracts for duplicative IT services—like awarding 2 contracts to the same vendor for the same services. Eliminating duplication could save money. Agencies could help reduce duplication by Using existing contracts for categories of similar goods and services—a.k.a. category management—as the Office of Management and Budget suggests...
title: Information Technology: Selected Federal Agencies Need to Take Additional Actions to Reduce Contract Duplication
